meanings.definition: To assign a job or role to someone.
meanings.sent1: The manager will appoint a new team leader tomorrow.
meanings.sent2: They will appoint a teacher to lead the school play.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to appoint itself as the household chef.
meanings.sent4: The sun appoints the moon as its nightly companion.
meanings.sent5: The superhero appoints a sidekick to help fight crime.

meanings.definition: To decide on a time or place for an event.
meanings.sent1: Let's appoint Saturday for our picnic in the park.
meanings.sent2: The committee will appoint a date for the charity fundraiser.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel tried to appoint a tree for its birthday party.
meanings.sent4: The clouds appoint the sky as the canvas for their dance.
meanings.sent5: The clock appoints midnight as the start of a new day.

meanings.definition: To select someone for a position or duty.
meanings.sent1: The board will appoint a new CEO next month.
meanings.sent2: She appointed her sister as the captain of the team.
meanings.sent3: The dog tried to appoint itself as the household protector.
meanings.sent4: The heart appoints love as its eternal ruler.
meanings.sent5: The wizard appoints an apprentice to carry on the magic.
